revised_title: Observations of Double and Triple Stars and a Description of a Five-Feet Equatorial Instrument
tldr: The authors present observations of the apparent distances and positions of 380 double and triple stars made between 1821 and 1823. They also describe a five-feet equatorial instrument used in the observations. The study includes a comparison of their findings with those of other astronomers and an analysis of changes in the stars' positions since their initial discovery.
